div.p: Each of us approaches learning in a different way.
Some of us are visual learners-- essentially we learn by seeing.
Some like to listen to what they are learning-- auditory learners.
Others are kinesthetic and prefer learning by doing.
Still others are some combination of the three.
Understanding how we learn allows us to employ techniques
that best suit the particular learning style.
For example, visual learners may benefit from watching a short video on a particular topic.
An auditory learner may want to read aloud from the textbook.
Kinesthetic learners may find the activity of highlighting material
in the textbook to be beneficial.
To determine your own style of learning and how to make the most of it,
a number of learning style inventories are available on the Internet.
